data.title: Pascagoula native wins William Faulkner Literary award
data.meta_description: The William Faulkner Literary Committee has selected Pascagoula native Martin Hegwood as the 2022 winner of the Novel Category for his manuscript titled Memphis.
data.text:
NEW ALBANY, Mississippi -- The William Faulkner Literary Committee has selected Pascagoula native Martin Hegwood as the 2022 winner of the Novel Category for his manuscript titled Memphis.

Hegwood’s selection was announced at the 25th annual William Faulkner Literary Luncheon, an event held each September in New Albany, where Faulkner was born in 1897. Other categories of competition included poetry, short stories, and one-act plays. The competition is limited to literary works that have not yet been published.

The contest in international in scope, and this year drew 353 entries from 43 states and 10 foreign countries. Hegwood, who now splits his time between Canton and Pascagoula, is the only Mississippian in the history of the competition to win first place in the Novel Category.

He has previously published four novels with St. Martin’s Press of New York, and his book Green-Eyed Hurricane won the Mississippi Author’s Award for Fiction given annually for the best work of fiction by a Mississippi writer.

Hegwood is currently conducting research for a limited biography of Faulkner and his time in Pascagoula in the mid-to-late 1920s.

Information about the William Faulkner Literary Competition can be found online at http://williamfaulknerliterarycompetition.com.

For a listing of this year’s winners in all categories, see the following article:
